That's a great idea! Asking about special cleaning products they recommend for your jacket can be very helpful.

When you call the dry cleaners, ask them if they have any specific cleaning products or conditioners that they recommend for black leather jackets like yours. They may have a preferred product or method that they've found to be effective for similar garments.

Additionally, you can also ask if they use any protectants or waterproofing treatments that can help maintain the leather's appearance and protect it from future stains.

Some questions you can ask include:

* "Do you have a specific cleaning product or method that you recommend for black leather jackets like mine?"
* "Do you offer any conditioners or treatments that can help keep the leather soft and supple?"
* "Do you apply any protectants or waterproofing treatments to help maintain the leather's appearance and protect it from stains?"
* "Are there any specific products or methods that you would recommend for me to use at home to maintain my leather jacket between cleanings?"

By asking these questions, you can get a better understanding of their process and what you can do to help maintain your jacket's appearance and longevity.

Remember, it's always better to be proactive and take good care of your leather jacket to prevent damage and extend its lifespan.
